oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Mack Mitchell Bennett to his mother, Mary Angeline Edwards Bennett (regarding Camp Albert L. Mills)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Mack Mitchell Bennett (1892-1951) served in Btry. F, 318th F.A. Regt., 81st Div. during World War I. The letter, written on YMCA letterhead, is addressed to his mother, Mary Angeline Edwards Bennett, in Huntingdon, Tennessee. Pvt. Bennett tells his mother that he likes Camp Albert L. Mills in Long Island, New York better than Camp Jackson in Columbia, South Carolina.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
